projects.name: PARALLELISED CRAFTML
projects.description: A hybrid parallel implementation of CRAFTML an Efficient Clustering-based Random Forest for Extreme Multi-label Learning. Uses tree randomization, spherical k-means and a hashing trick for projection and sampling. 3.11x speedup on 4 cores.

projects.name: TIC-TAC-TRASH BOT
projects.description: An AI bot that plays a modified version of ultimate tic-tac-toe using various game techniques. It implements Minimax Search with alpha-beta pruning and quiescence search. Uses an adaptive heuristic that changes expected utilities based on the state of the game. Rank : 5/74 teams in tournament.

projects.name: SC COMPILER
projects.description: Three phased compiler architecture for a C like language with lexer (using ANTLR4 parser generator), syntax analyzer and LLVM IR generation(as backend).

projects.name: ADXGAME AGENT
projects.description: Designed an agent for playing a simplistic version of Adx Game for a tournament where the agents play the role of ad networks in a market simulation. Ranked 2/11 teams.

projects.name: ARCADE GAMES
projects.description: Designed Space Invaders & Super Mario using pygame; Jetpack Joyride, Flight Shooter (3D simulation with multiple viewpoints), Subway Surfer using OpenGL/WebGL.

experiences.description: Developed an end-to-end feature for SLA Pause/Resume on Polaris, that would help the users stop the scheduled protection tasks (backup, replication and archival operations) on objects to which a Polaris SLA is assigned and resume the tasks as and when required. Used Cassandra for stable storage and Data Object Access Pattern for interacting with it. Created GraphQL APIs and exposed them to the UI to integrate them with UI/UX. Added backend support for multiple cluster pause, can be parallelized using goroutines.

experiences.company_name: Centre for Security, Theory and Algorithmic Research, IIIT Hyderabad
experiences.description: Efficient Parallel algorithms for Percolation Centrality Computation under Dr. Kishore Kothapalli: Work on algorithms that compute the source and source-destination variants of the percolation centrality values of nodes in a network using Modified Brandes and Graph Shattering achieving significant speedups on both multicore CPU and GPU. Results: 3.2x and 2.2x speedups for respective variants. Publication in 29th IEEE International Conference on High Performance Computing, Data, & Analytics under the track, High Performance Computing - Applications. Follow-up Work on Dynamic and Approximate Algorithms for Percolation Centrality.

Contest Admin, AlgoUniversity: AlgoUniversity, backed by worlds top accelerator YCombinator, is an online academy helping early-stage engineers to prepare for job/internship interviews. As a contest admin, working towards setting up the first home grown platform catering internal contests, assessments and global coding events. Remote Content Extern, Hackerrank: Problem curation, testing and editorial preparation. Codeforces: Problem Setter and Tester for the following events: CodeCraft-20 (Div. 2), CodeCraft-19 and Codeforces Round 537 (Div. 2). Codechef: Problem Setter and Tester for the following events: November Cook-Off 2020, January to April Long Challenges 2021. Codechef CP Basics Camp, Hyderabad: Worked as an Instructor for Competitive Programming in Summer 2019.

full_output.name: Sayantan Jana

ACM ICPC 2020: Team: champions_unknown, Regionals Rank: 38, Preliminary Round Rank: 42
ACM ICPC 2019: Team: L9, Regionals Rank: 142, Preliminary Round Rank: 107
